skill.name: github-issues
skill.description: GitHub issues management assistant for Logseq Template Graph. Analyzes issues, triages with labels, plans implementations, generates responses, creates PRs, and manages issue lifecycle. Use when handling bug reports, feature requests, questions, or coordinating development through GitHub issues.
skill.summary: GitHub issues management assistant for Logseq Template Graph. Analyzes issues, triages with labels, ...
skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and workflow instructions. No executable code, scripts, or network operations. Uses standard gh CLI commands documented in plain text. Capabilities directly match stated purpose of GitHub issues management.

content.user_title: Manage GitHub issues with AI assistance
content.value_statement: Manually triaging GitHub issues takes significant time and can lead to inconsistent responses. This skill automates issue analysis, validation, labeling, and response generation using structured workflows and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Analyze and validate issues against codebase and git history
Apply appropriate labels based on type, priority, status, and scope
Generate responses for bugs, features, questions, and documentation requests
Identify duplicates, dependencies, and related issues
Create implementation plans and track issue lifecycle
Coordinate with other skills for Schema.org research and commits
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) installed and authenticated
Limited to Logseq Template Graph project context
Cannot access private repositories without gh authentication

use_cases.title: Automated issue triage
use_cases.description: Automatically validate bug reports, identify duplicates, and apply labels to new issues within 48 hours

use_cases.title: Feature request handling
use_cases.description: Generate implementation plans, research Schema.org alignment, and coordinate dependency tracking

use_cases.title: Workflow coordination
use_cases.description: Track issue progress, link PRs to issues, and manage release announcements

prompt_templates.title: Triage new issue
prompt_templates.scenario: A new issue was just opened
prompt_templates.prompt: Triage GitHub issue #123. Validate if the bug exists, search for duplicates, check git history, and provide a response with appropriate labels.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze feature request
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze feature request #456. Check if feature already exists, find related issues, research Schema.org alignment, and create an implementation plan.

prompt_templates.title: Close duplicate issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Issue #789 is a duplicate of #456. Close it with a helpful response linking to the original and encourage adding context there.

prompt_templates.title: Generate release notes
prompt_templates.prompt: Issue #321 is now fixed in PR #325. Update the issue with release notes, close it, and summarize the changes for users.

output_examples.input: Triage issue #42 about missing Recipe class
output: Thank you for reporting this! I investigated the issue.
Validation: Recipe class already exists in v0.5.0+
Added in commit a688c4b with properties: recipeIngredient, cookTime, prepTime

best_practices: Always validate issues against codebase before responding - never assume reporter is correct
Search open and closed issues to identify duplicates and related work
Apply labels consistently using the taxonomy: type, priority, status, scope, and special labels
Link issues to PRs using Fixes/Closes keywords for automatic closure
anti_patterns: Responding without validation - always check git history and codebase first
Leaving issues unlabeled - apply appropriate labels immediately
Ignoring duplicates - always search for related issues before responding
Forgetting to link PRs to issues - use keywords in PR descriptions

faq.question: What tools are required for this skill?
faq.answer: GitHub CLI (gh) must be installed and authenticated. Logseq Template Graph project context required.

faq.question: Can this skill work with private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, if gh is authenticated with appropriate permissions for the private repository.

faq.question: What issue types are supported?
faq.answer: Bugs, features, questions, documentation requests, and refactoring tasks with templates for each.

faq.question: How does duplicate detection work?
faq.answer: Searches issue titles, bodies, and git history for keywords and related concepts using gh and grep.

faq.question: Can this skill create branches and commits?
faq.answer: Yes, provides git commands for creating branches, commits, and PRs linking to issues.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Actions automation?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered analysis and responses. GitHub Actions handles automation. Best used together.
